entry.title: Ukraine Renews Calls for Weapons as Zelensky Visits Troops in Northeast
entry.content: Kyiv’s fresh appeals to Western nations came as Russia’s offensive threatened the final Ukrainian strongholds in the Luhansk region and Ukraine’s president traveled to Kharkiv for the first time since the full-scale invasion began.

entry.title: Anglican Church's Rifts Over Sexuality Challenge Its Leader
entry.content: Archbishop Justin Welby has hoped to unify a denomination increasingly torn between conservatives, many in Africa, and liberals, particularly in the U.S. But so far, he has failed to reverse the growing rift.

entry.title: China's Lockdowns Prompt a Rethinking of Life Plans Among the Young
entry.content: Versions of Shanghai’s lockdown are playing out across the country, adding to anxiety among many younger Chinese over limited upward mobility and dissipating their desire to start families, buy apartments or start businesses.

entry.title: A Ukrainian Woman Greeted Troops With a Soviet Flag. Now, She Tells Putin to Stop Killing Ukrainians.
entry.content: Anna Ivanova has emerged as a symbol for Russian propaganda, inspiring monuments across the country. But her tale is one of grief and poverty in the post-Soviet world.
